prerequisite.other: You can only choose this feat as the origin feat.

items: Your maximum for the chosen ability score increases by 2.
You age at half speed and the expected maximum age for your race doubles.

When you fail a {@variantrule D20 Test|Ishiir}, you can roll a {@dice d4} and add it to the result. You can choose to use this feature after you see the roll, but before the DM determineds the result. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

When you {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell} that forces one or more creatures to make a STR, DEX, or CON {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can instead force them to make a different {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} from among these three.

When you {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell} that forces one or more creatures to make a INT, WIS, or CHA {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can instead force them to make a different {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} from among these three.
{@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks} to counterspell, dispel, or otherwise disrupt or remove your spells have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}.
The damage of your Breath Weapon racial feature increases by {@dice 1d6} ({@dice 5d6}). The damage increment doubles at the levels 6 ({@dice 7d6}), 11 ({@dice 9d6}), and 16 ({@dice 11d6}).

Additionally, your breath weapon increases in size as you grow stronger. For each point of {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} above 2 your breath weapon grows by 10 feet if it is a line and by 5 feet if it is a cone.
Further, you gain additional features related to your Breath Weapon based on your Draconic Ancestry:

items.name: Black
entries: Every creature that failed its {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your breath weapon also takes acid damage equal to double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} at the beginning of each of its turns for 1 minute and its AC is reduced by 2. An affected creature can make a CON save at the end of each of its turns to end this effect.

items.name: Blue
entries: Every creature that failed its {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your breath weapon is also {@condition Dazed|Ishiir} for 1 minute. An affected creature can make a CON save at the end of each of its turns to end this effect.

items.name: Brass
entries: You can choose to exhale sleep gas in a 15 ft. cone with your breath weapon instead. Every creature in the area of effect must succed on a CON {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your breath weapon DC or fall {@condition Unconscious|Ishiir} for 10 minutes. This effect ends if the creature takes damage or another creature uses it's action to wake it.

items.name: Bronze
entries: You can choose to exhale repulsive energy in a 15 ft. cone with your breath weapon instead. Every creature in the area of effect must succed on a STR {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your breath weapon DC or take bludgeoning damage equal to half your breath weapon damage and be pushed away 30 feet and knocked {@condition Prone|Ishiir}. If it collides with a creature or object, both it and the creature or object take bludgeoning damage equal to half your breath weapon damage.

items.name: Copper
entries: You can choose exhale befuddling gas in a 15 ft. cone with your breath weapon instead. Every creature in the area of effect must succed on a WIS {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your breath weapon DC or fall {@condition Prone|Ishiir} laughing incontrollably for 1 minute. While under this effect, a creature is {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} and cannot stand up. A creature with an Intelligence score of 4 or less isn't affected.
At the end of each of its turns, and when it takes damage, an affected creature can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, ending the effect on a success.

items.name: Gold
entries: You can choose to exhale weakening energy with your breath weapon instead. Every creature in the area of effect must succeed on a CON {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. If it fails, it suffers 1 level of {@condition Exhaustion|Ishiir} at the start of each of its turns for 1 minute. An affected creature can make a CON save at the end of each of its turns. On a success, it does not suffer a level of {@condition Exhaustion|Ishiir} at the beginning of its next turn, but the effect persists. If it succeeds on the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} three times, the effect ends.

items.name: Green
entries: Every creature that failed its {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your breath weapon is also {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} for 1 minute. An affected creature can make a CON save at the end of each of its turns to end this effect.

items.name: Red
entries: Your breath weapon's damage increases by {@dice 2d6} times half your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} (rounded down) and the base size of its cone increases to 45 ft.

Additionally every creature that failed its {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your breath weapon is also set aflame and takes fire damage equal to double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} modifier at the beginning of each of its turns for 1 minute. An affected creature can make a DEX save at the end of each of its turns to end this effect.

items.name: Silver
entries: You can choose to exhale paralyzing energy in a 15 ft. cone with your breath weapon instead. Every creature in the area of effect must succed on a CON {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your breath weapon DC or be {@condition Paralyzed|Ishiir} for 1 minute. A creature can make a CON save at the end of each of its turns to end this effect.

items.name: White
entries: Every creature that failed its {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your breath weapon is also {@condition Restrained|Ishiir} for 1 minute. An affected creature can make a STR save at the end of each of its turns to end this effect.

feat.name: Blazing Heart
entries: Your heart burns with an old pact of fire.

items: You are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to Fire damage.
Once on your turn, when you deal damage with a weapon attack or a spell, you can add fire damage equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus to the damage dealt against one creature.
You gain an extra tonic and salve known.
Double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with {@item Alchemist's Supplies|Ishiir} and {@item Herbalism Kit}.
You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to quickly prepare an tonic once per {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can choose one allied creature within 30 ft that you can see. This creature also benefits from your Pack Tactics racial feature until the beginning of your next turn.

When an allied creature critically hits a creature you can see within 5 ft of you or knocks it prone, you can immediately use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to make a melee weapon attack with the natural weapons gained from your Vicious Fangs racial feature against that creature.

When you hit a creature with a melee weapon that does not have the heavy or two-handed property, you can cause the weapon to deal extra damage to the target. The extra damage equals your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} Bonus.
Your critical range with melee weapons increases by 1. This effect does not apply to weapons with the heavy or two-handed property.

Once per turn, when you use the {@optfeature Lunge|Ishiir} mastery or attack a target with a melee weapon after moving at least 10 feet towards it in a straight line, you can choose to ignore {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} for your {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} and the target cannot use a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} that uses this attack as a trigger.
When you land a critical hit with a melee weapon, roll an additional weapon die and add it to the damage total.
Once on your turn, when you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action, you can attempt to {@action Shove|Ishiir} a creature without replacing one of your attacks.

You can attempt a {@action Grapple|Ishiir} while wielding a two-handed or versatile weapon in one hand. While grappling a creature, you can still make attacks with your weapon as if you were wielding it in two hands.

feat.name: Dragon Fear
entries: When angered, you radiate menace. You gain the following benefits:

items: Instead of exhaling destructive energy, you can expend a use of your Breath Weapon trait to roar, forcing each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you to make a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} (DC 8 + your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus + your Charisma modifier). A target automatically succeeds on the save if it can't hear or see you. On a failed save, a target becomes {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} of you for 1 minute. If the {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} target takes any damage, it can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, ending the effect on itself on a success. If you also have Ancient Blood feat, the radius of this feature increases to 60 feet.

feat.name: Dragon Hide
entries: You manifest scales and claws reminiscent of draconic creatures. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your scales harden. While you aren't wearing armor, you can calculate your AC as 13 + {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

You grow retractable claws from the tips of your fingers. Extending or retracting the claws requires no action. The claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir|Unarmed Strikes}, and deal {@dice 1d6} slashing damage on a hit. You can choose your whether to use your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.
If you have another feature or effect that modifies the die size of your unarmed attacks, that die size instead increases by 1 step if you use your claws to attack.

feat.name: Fierce Flames
entries: You learn to call on hellfire to serve your commands. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you roll fire damage for a spell you cast, you can reroll any roll of 1 on the fire damage dice, but you must use the new roll, even if it is another 1. If you already have a feature that allows you to reroll spell damage, you instead increase the reroll threshold to 2 if the spell deals fire damage.

Whenever you {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell} that deals fire damage, you can cause flames to wreathe you until the end of your next turn. The flames don't harm you or your possessions, and they shed bright light out to 30 feet and dim light for an additional 30 feet. While the flames are present, any creature within 5 feet of you that hits you with a melee attack takes {@dice 1d4} fire damage.

feat.name: Flow Like Water
entries: The influence of the Tree of Life has strengthened your connection to the plane of water.

items: If you are {@condition Grappled|Ishiir}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to not be {@condition Grappled|Ishiir}.
Any water-based spell you cast is considered one level higher.
All water-based spells are considered class spells for you and are added to your spell list.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} against any water based effect.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against becoming {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} or cursed.

You can use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to curse a creature of your choice you can see within 90 ft. The creature is treated as under the effect of the Hex spell, except that you do not concentrate on it and it only lasts for 1 minute.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus. You regain all expended uses after you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

When you are forced to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or take damage from a creature you can see within 30 ft you, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to force the creature to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against a DC equal to 8 + your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} + your CON, INT, WIS or CHA modifier (your choice).
On a failure, the creature is under the effect of the Bane spell, which does not require {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} and lasts until its full duration.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to half your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus (rounded down). You regain all expended uses after you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

When you take damage that drops you below 0 hitpoints but doesn't outright kill you, you drop to 1 hitpoint instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. In addition, you make death {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} with {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir}.

When you drop to 50% of your maximum hitpoints or lower in combat, you make {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against ongoing effects on you at the beginning of your turn instead of at the end.
You roll these {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} before determining any of the effects that happen at the beginning of your turn.

While in direct sunlight, {@skill Insight} and {@skill Investigation} checks are made with {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir}. And while above 50% hp gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.

You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with {@skill Insight} or {@skill Investigation}. If you already {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|Proficient}, you double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus for any check you make with it.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against the {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} and {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} conditions.

When you craft something, you can choose to increase the amount of time required by 1/2 of the original (rounded down). If you do so, the DC decreases by an amount equal to half your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus (rounded down) and the item receives the masterwork property even if you only roll two successes for the crafting check.

When you craft an item that requires a base material, e.g. steel or high steel for weaponsmithing, you can treat the material you use as one step higher for the purposes of allowing the item to be a mastercraft and qualifying for additional properties. If you do so, you calculate the DC for the crafting attempt as if you had used the higher material. You must still fulfill all other requirements for the crafting attempt, such as crafting station.
You can cast {@spell Minor Illusion|Ishiir} at will.
While under direct moonlight, your illusion spells are considered one level higher and lose their vocal component.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against illusions and skill checks to identify illusions.

When you use your Harfolk Hardiness racial feature, roll additional hit dice equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} and add them to the total. You gain the amount rolled as temporary HP, rather than reducing the incoming damage by it.

If you are hit by an attack or a spell that causes effects additionally to dealing damage, you are not subject to these effects as long as the damage does not exceed the number of temporary HP from this feature.

In addition, you may now use this feature outside of combat without a damage trigger. If you do so, you can decide to gain back HP equal to half the amount rolled rather than temporary HP, but not above your max HP.

You learn the magic of the primeval woods, which are revered and protected by your people. You learn one druid cantrip of your choice. You also learn the {@spell Longstrider|Ishiir} and {@spell Pass without Trace|Ishiir} spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for all three spells. You can also cast them using spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with {@skill Deception} or {@skill Persuasion}. If you already {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|Proficient}, you double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus for any check you make with it.
When haggling you always gain the upper hand, gaining a 10% discount on your purchases / profit on your sales.
When you use the {@action Dash|Ishiir} action or the {@action Disengage|Ishiir} action, you can use the other as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.
